channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: About
item.description:
TEST Page How To Add a Page in Hugo Now that we’ve added a post to our Hugo site, let’s add a page. Most content management systems, including WordPress, distinguish between posts and pages. Typically, a post is a dated piece of content, while a page consists of evergreen or static content.

To create a page, we first need a page content section. To do this, create a folder named pages in Hugo’s content folder. Afterward, use the command below to add a new “About” page to your site:
item.content:encoded:
TEST Page How To Add a Page in Hugo Now that we’ve added a post to our Hugo site, let’s add a page. Most content management systems, including WordPress, distinguish between posts and pages. Typically, a post is a dated piece of content, while a page consists of evergreen or static content.

To create a page, we first need a page content section. To do this, create a folder named pages in Hugo’s content folder. Afterward, use the command below to add a new “About” page to your site:
